page.title: 09West Court Farm, Oldland
page.content: Situated directly opposite Redfield Edge school, covering area of 140 acres, i.e. 40 acres grassland and 90 acres arable. Crops grown are wheat, barley and potatoes. The 940 year old{ {farmhouse}was mentioned in the first Domesday Book. The family have been in farming for 50 years, running it as a family business. During busy months, self-employed workers are used. Approximately 100 head cattle are kept at a time - cull cattle i.e. former dairy cattle are now kept for fattening. After 12 weeks lush pasture, cattle are slaughtered at nearby abattoir, owned by same family. Beef cattle are the only livestock kept. Majority of income comes from land. Machinery includes baler, fertiliser spinner, tractors, plough and hay baling equipment.
